intro: Exacum grandiflorum, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Exacum grandiflorum thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
